text: obama shakes lebanon incentives for ESPN
and the government shutdown revisited
good afternoon this is the New York
Times minute a powerful blast shook
central Beirut this morning killing six
and injuring dozens more among the dead
and the likely target is the former
lebanese minister and ambassador to the
united states he was a vocal critic of
the syrian government and its ally
hezbollah what do you give a
multi-billion dollar sports conglomerate
headquartered in your state that has
everything tax incentives of course in
today's times a look at how connecticut
officials have been showering
bristol-based ESPN with millions in tax
breaks and credits and a look back at
the first federal government shutdown in
nearly two decades the 16-day shutdown
caused over six million days of lost
work and two billion dollars in back pay
costs but remember we got a budget deal
for the first time in years and that
budget deal was only because nobody
wanted another shutdown
